name: Thismia calcarata

name: Thismia mantiqueirensis
distribution: São Paulo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.570.2.8 Etymology: 'The specific epithet refers to the Mantiqueira mountains, where the species was discovered'.

name: Thismia petasiformis
distribution: Mato Grosso (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.564.2.5 Etymology: the specific epithet (Latin: pĕtăsus: i, m) refers to its hat-shaped mitre.

name: Thismia pseudomelanomitra
distribution: Mato Grosso (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America)

name: Thismia ribeiroi
distribution: Mato Grosso (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.429.4.2 The species epithet is an homage to Ricardo da Silva Ribeiro, the collector of the type material, at the time, biology student and scholarship holder in Mato Grosso State University, linked to HERBAM.

name: Thismia variabilis
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.587.3.5 Etymology: 'The specific epithet refers the great variation in the tepals size, dilated connective lobes and interstaminal lobes'.

name: Thismia violacea
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.620.2.7 Etymology: name refers to the colour of the flower.

name: Triscyphus fungiformis
reference: Overs. Kongel. Danske Vidensk. Selsk. Forh. Medlemmers Arbeider 1901: 178, tab. 4. 1902
